Detailed Description

This is related to, but not the same as, ComponentFactory, mainly because only a framework is likely to implement the functions here.

This interface will always be paired with at least one ComponentFactory to be useful.

Member Function Documentation

array< string > ccaffeine.ports.Loader.getComponentPath (   ) 
 

Returns:
the list of directories searched for .cca files.

void ccaffeine.ports.Loader.loadComponent (  in string  name,
in bool  globalTable,
in bool  lazy
) 
 

Cause the named class to become instantiable by a subsequent call to createComponentInstance().

This may require side effects with dlopen. In dlopen terms, lazy=true -> RTLD_LAZY, false->RTLD_NOW; globalTable=true ->RTLD_GLOBAL, false->RTLD_LOCAL.

Parameters:
name this is either the palette class alias or the babel
globalTable rtld_global to use.
lazy rtld_lazy to use. class name. If there is a conflict, the palette class alias wins.

void ccaffeine.ports.Loader.loadComponentDescription (  in string  uri  ) 
 

Parse a file for component descriptions and add them to some internal repository list.

This does *not* mean that the component classes described are loaded.

int ccaffeine.ports.Loader.loadPortLibrary (  in string  libraryPath  ) 
 

Cause the named port interface library to be dynamically loaded.

The librar will be loaded globally, as interfaces between components must be globally defined. This is particularly relevant to C++ implementations and may not mean anything for other languages.

Returns:
0 if loaded, nonzero if some problem detected.

void ccaffeine.ports.Loader.setComponentPath (  in array< string >  paths  ) 
 

Replace current path with new paths.

each vector element is one directory name. Path is searched for .cca elements. To append or prepend the path: get the path, adjust the array, and set the path. If a particular operating system requires modification to external library path environment variables, that remains not our responsibility here.
